page.title: 13Talke Pits near Talke
page.content: Talke Pits is an extension of Talke about 1km to the south.It was named after the coalmines which used to be nearby.There are a few old terraced houses which are all that remains of the original houses,a council estate which was built in 1951 and a private housing estate built about 25 years ago.Talke Pits has a primary school called Springhead.There used to be St,Martins infants school but that closed down in 1983.There is a library,a doctors surgery and a village hall.The doctorÂ£s surgery and the village hall were built where there was once a Methodist chapel.There are lots of shops including a post office,butchers,newsagent,grocers,wool shop,chipshop,hairdressers......There are two pubs called the king William and the Skylark .
